pageTitle: Vietnam Tour of Duty Photographs from Kevin Brooks
pageIntro:
A collection of photographs from Kevin Brooks (Charlie Company, 1st Battalion / 3rd Marines) taken during his tour of duty in the Vietnam War.

Photographs © 1967-2019 Kevin Brooks; published with permission as compliments to The Cage, an in-progress book project.

photos.subtitle: June 15, 1967
photos.content: First day in Vietnam. Helo to Camp Evans. Picture taken S of city of Hue.

photos.subtitle: June 15, 1967
photos.content: Flying over city of Hue on way to Camp Evans.

photos.subtitle: June 17, 1967
photos.content: Passing Hue Cathedral on a truck headed to DaNang.

photos.subtitle: June 17, 1967
photos.content: On truck trip between Camp Evans and Danang. Picture taken between Hue and Phu Bai.

photos.subtitle: June 30, 1967
photos.content: USS Okinawa (LPH-3) in the South China Sea. The Okinawa was home to the squadron of H-34 helicopters and also Charlie and Delta rifle companies plus the Battalion Command Group.

photos.subtitle: June 30, 1967
photos.content: USS Okinawa at sunset in Gulf of Tonkin

photos.subtitle: June 30, 1967
photos.content: Sunset on USS Okinawa in the Gulf of Tonkin

photos.subtitle: July 3, 1967
photos.content: Preparing for Operation Buffalo on hanger deck of USS Okinawa on 4 hours notice. Tall Marine without helmet is 1st Lt. Bill Neuss, XO of Charlie Company. To his right with radio is Cpl. Harry Stidham, my Artillery FO radio operator.

photos.subtitle: July 3, 1967
photos.content: Operation Buffalo. With Cpl. Harry Stidham (at left), my Arty FO radio operator. Me, Kevin Brooks, at left.

photos.subtitle: July 3, 1967
photos.content: Operation Buffalo. Flight into area E of Con Thien called the Market Place.

photos.subtitle: July 3, 1967
photos.content: Operation Buffalo. BLT 1/3 landing SE of Con Thien, just S of the Marketplace.

photos.subtitle: July 5, 1967
photos.content: Operation Buffalo. Air and artillery strikes on DMZ near The Marketplace.

photos.subtitle: July 12, 1967
photos.content: Helicopters from HMM-362 landing on USS Okinawa.

photos.subtitle: July 12, 1967
photos.content: USS Cimarron (O-22) retrieving fuel lines.
USS Okinawa, USS Cimarron and USS Hermitage during refueling process.

photos.subtitle: July 12, 1967

photos.subtitle: July 19, 1967
photos.content: USS Hermitage, where Alpha Battery, 1st Bn/12th Marines was berthed, being refused by USS Cimarron (O-22).

photos.subtitle: July 19, 1967
photos.content: Refueling at sea. USS Cimarron (O-22) pulls alongside USS Okinawa.
Operation Beacon Guide along Highway #1 between Hue and Danang

photos.subtitle: July 29, 1967

photos.content: Charlie Company 1/3 formation on USS Okinawa to present promotions and awards. Captain Reczek (Company CO) and 1st Sgt. Campo make the presentations.
